I imagine it could look like this:

heritrix
    archive-commons
    heritrix-core
    admin-webapp
    selftest-webapp

The webapps would depend on heritrix-core which would depend on commons. 

But it could also be modelled otherwise.   For example, archive-commons 
might be moved outside of Heritrix to its own project.  And going by the 
current state of our Pauls' setttings refactoring, its looking like the 
selftest webapp might be washed away, redone as unit tests.  Also, when 
he is done, a bunch more code will be freed up for use outside of 
org.archive.crawler package. Perhaps we will have maven produce a jar of 
processors.

Opinions/suggestions/help are all welcome.
St.Ack

   

Laurian Gridinoc wrote:
>
> On 13/03/07, Michael Stack <stack@... 
> <mailto:stack%40archive.org>> wrote:
> > > I heard that you consider to move to Maven2, is this scheduled 
> sometime soon?
> > I've been practicing the migration over on the archive-access sister 
> project and its been taking up a bunch of time. The move from m1 to 
> m2, in effect, requires a complete rewrite of our build (There is an 
> m2 repository at http://builds.archive.org:8080/maven2/ 
> <http://builds.archive.org:8080/maven2/> and continuum is running at 
> http://builds.archive.org:8081/continuum/servlet/continuum 
> <http://builds.archive.org:8081/continuum/servlet/continuum>). I do 
> not see us getting to Heritrix in time for the 1.12 release.
>
> OK, I'm curious how the pom file would be, which would be the modules,
> dependencies, etc.
>
> Cheers,
> -- 
> Laurian Gridinoc, purl.org/net/laur
>
>
